title: Sri Lanka gross official reserves down 2-pct US$2,361mn in Feb 22
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s gross official reserves were reported at 2,361 million US dollars in February 2022, down 2 percent from a month earlier as the monetary authority struggles to maintain foreign assets which are being redeemed against money it is printing.
Gross official reserves are down about 2.26 billion US dollars from 4.5 billion US dollars a year earlier.

Unable to collect reserves by sterilizing inflows (selling down domestic assets) the central bank had borrowed reserves mainly through swaps. It also has a loan due to the International Monetary Fund.

From February 2021 to January 2022 the central bank’s net reserves fell 5.2 billion dollars. In the same period about 1.3 billion rupees had been printed and reserve money grew over 300 billion rupees.
By end January net reserves were a negative 3.9 billion US dollars.
In January the central bank sought and received a deferment from India on a 525 million dollar cross-border payment for India. (Colombo/Ma07/2022)
